p: In 2018, nearly 38 million people were living with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), of whom 20.64 million live in sub‐Saharan Africa. There has been a 56% decline in AIDS‐related deaths from the peak of 1.7 million in 2004 to 770,000 in 2018, likely due to the three‐fold increase in people receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART) since 2010 [ 1]. While there has been significant progress to scale up HIV testing and treatment, the incidence of HIV infection remains high, with an estimated 1.7 million newly infected people in 2018 [ 1].
